atomica.ui.util.board
Class EditorBoardPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  atomica.ui.util.components.AtomicaPanel
                      atomica.ui.util.board.BoardPanel
                          atomica.ui.util.board.EditorBoardPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.Observer, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class EditorBoardPanel
extends BoardPanel
implements java.util.Observer

Displays an editable game board which also allows user interaction by adding new tokens or moving/deleting existing ones.

Author:
Georg Ludewig
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Method Detail

paintCursor

protected void paintCursor(Field field,
                           java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
Depending on the current editor mode (ADD, MOVE, DELETE) a corresponding mouse cursor is painted. While the editor is in MOVE or ADD mode, the token which is about being moved or added will be painted. When the editor is in DELETE mode a delete image will be shown on cursor position.

Overrides:
paintCursor in class BoardPanel
Parameters:
field - the field where to paint a cursor image
g2 - the Graphics2D object
See Also:
BoardPanel.paintCursor(atomica.objects.Field, java.awt.Graphics2D)

paintDeleteCursor

private void paintDeleteCursor(Field field,
                               java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
Paints a delete cursor at the given field position.

Parameters:
field - the field where to paint the delete cursor
g2 - the Graphic2D object

paintFieldHighLight

protected void paintFieldHighLight(Field field,
                                   java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
Paints field highlights if a token on the board is selected to be moved. A highlight will be painted on the field of the selected token as well as on the field of the current mouse position.

Overrides:
paintFieldHighLight in class BoardPanel
Parameters:
field - the field where to paint a highlight
g2 - the Graphic2D object to paint to
See Also:
BoardPanel.paintFieldHighLight(atomica.objects.Field, java.awt.Graphics2D)

update

public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
Due to observer pattern this method receives notification from the model (Editor). It takes the current game situation from the editor and repaints it.

Specified by:
update in interface java.util.Observer
See Also:
Observer.update(java.util.Observable, java.lang.Object)

handleMouseDragged

protected void handleMouseDragged(int x,
                                  int y)
Due to supporting also the adding/deleting of tokens while dragging, this method simply forwards to handleMouseMoved and handleMouseReleased.

Overrides:
handleMouseDragged in class BoardPanel
Parameters:
x - the horizontal position of the mouse cursor
y - the vertical position of the mouse cursor
See Also:
BoardPanel.handleMouseDragged(int, int)

handleMouseMoved

protected void handleMouseMoved(int x,
                                int y)
Sets the current cursorPostionField so that this field is highlighted after a repaint.

Overrides:
handleMouseMoved in class BoardPanel
Parameters:
x - the horizontal position of the mouse cursor
y - the vertical position of the mouse cursor
See Also:
BoardPanel.handleMouseMoved(int, int)

handleMouseReleased

protected void handleMouseReleased(int x,
                                   int y)
Releasing the mouse indicates that a token is either being about to be deleted, moved or added. This information is here delegated to the model (Editor). Due to the observer pattern, the editor will notify about changes.

Overrides:
handleMouseReleased in class BoardPanel
Parameters:
x - the horizontal position of the mouse cursor
y - the vertical position of the mouse cursor
See Also:
BoardPanel.handleMouseReleased(int, int)
